primaryText:
The answer is C! Wowza! Normally we'd just say congrats if you guessed that, but let's break it down:

Did you know that brushing for 2 mins with the tap running pours around 15 litres of water down the drain?

That's enough water to fill 30 glasses. Every single time you brush.

Small changes = big impact. Start today.

I went from 0 to 1,247 members in my Skool community in 90 days.

No cold DMs. No posting 5x/day. No paid ads (at first).

Here's the exact 5-step framework I used:

1. Created a free lead magnet that solved ONE problem
2. Posted it in 3 Facebook groups (with permission)
3. Set up a simple welcome sequence
4. Hosted weekly live Q&As
5. Let members invite their friends with gamification

The result? $12,400/month recurring revenue.

Want the full breakdown? Link in bio.

primaryText:
Stop selling courses. Start building communities.

I made $2,300/month selling courses on Teachable.
I now make $47,000/month with a Skool community.

Same audience. Same niche. Different model.

The shift? I stopped treating my students as customers and started treating them as members.

Here's what changed:
‚úÖ 94% monthly retention (vs 0% with courses)
‚úÖ Members help each other (less support load)
‚úÖ Recurring revenue (predictable income)
‚úÖ Higher lifetime value per customer

Free training: How to convert your course into a thriving community üëá
basically how this week has been going üò≠!!

We spent $153,000 on Meta Ads for Skool communities last month.

Here are the 3 ad types that actually work:

üèÜ #1: The "Free Challenge" Ad
CPA: $2.40 | CTR: 4.2%
"Join our free 5-day challenge and learn [specific outcome]"

ü•à #2: The "Proof Stack" Ad
CPA: $3.10 | CTR: 3.8%

ü•â #3: The "Behind The Scenes" Ad
CPA: $4.50 | CTR: 3.1%

The worst performer? Generic "Join my community" ads.
CPA: $18+ | CTR: 0.9%
